page.title: 02BARFORD ST. MARTIN VILLAGE
page.content: Barford St. Martin is a small village with a parish church, small village shop and post office which sells a wide range of items, public house, and first school all in close proximity to one another at the eastern end of the village. Houses are mainly detached, some are very large with four or more bedrooms. Although many maintain a rustic appearance, being stone and often thatched, they are highly modernised, affording a high standard of living. It is now a linear village, spreading along the B road to Tisbury with a fairly large council estate at the western end. There is a children's play area near here. Apart from the small village shop, most shopping is undertaken in either Wilton or Salisbury. People also go to these places for entertainment.
